alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 11 at 10:42AM CST until March 13 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Saturday the stage was 24.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.6 feet late tonight, Mar 11th. It will then fall to 24.2 feet early Monday morning, Mar 13th. - Action stage is 24.5 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 11 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 24.4 Sat 9 AM 24.5 24.2 24.1 24.6 12 AM 3/12 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
